edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class KSServer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.KSServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class KSServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A KSServer provides the functionality to listen for and service multiple clients. This server object also provides methods to manage the clients once they are being serviced, as well as controlling the communication with the client.

public KSServer()

Method Detail

initialize

protected void initialize(KSFrame frame)
Initialize this server and start listening for clients on the DEFAULT_PORT. A call to this method will spawn the server on a new Thread.

initialize

protected void initialize(KSFrame frame,
                          int port)
Initialize this server and start listening for clients on the specified port. A call to this method will spawn the server on a new Thread.

Parameters:
frame - reference to the parent frame
port - desired port for which this server will listen for clients

isListening

protected boolean isListening()
Return the status of this server.

Returns:
return true if this server is currently listening for for clients; false otherwise.

getServicePort

protected int getServicePort()
Provide the port that this server will use to service clients.

Returns:
the server service port

listWorkerIDs

protected java.lang.String[] listWorkerIDs()
Provide a list of clients that the server is servicing.

Returns:
an array of worker ID's that are servicing clients

dropClient

protected void dropClient(java.lang.String workerID)
Terminate communication with a client.

Parameters:
workerID - the ID of the worker to terminate

dropAllClients

protected void dropAllClients()
Terminate communication with all clients.

removeResource

protected void removeResource(java.lang.String workerID)
Remove a worker from the current pool of workers.

Parameters:
workerID - the worker ID of the worker to remove

startTransmission

protected void startTransmission(java.lang.String controllerName,
                                 long interval)
Begin transmission of simulation data with a client.

Parameters:
controllerName - the client name to start transmission
interval - the time in milliseconds at which the service thread will wait until transmission of the next batch of simulator data.

stopTransmission

protected void stopTransmission()
Stop transmission of simulator data to all clients. The connections to the clients will remain alive. A subsequent call to startTransmission will begin transmission of simulator data to the clients once again.

kill

protected void kill()
Stop this server from listening for clients. Any active client connections will remain active.

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
